verses.verse: When He established the clouds above, When He strengthened the fountains of the deep,

(Gen. 1:9, 10; Job 38:8-11; Ps. 33:7; 104:9; Jer. 5:22) When He assigned to the sea its limit, So that the waters would not transgress His command, When (Job 28:4, 6; Ps. 104:5) He marked out the foundations of the earth,
((John 1:1-3, 18)) Then I was beside Him as a master craftsman; ((Matt. 3:17)) And I was daily His delight, Rejoicing always before Him,
Rejoicing in His inhabited world, And (Ps. 16:3; John 13:1) my delight was with the sons of men.
“Now therefore, listen to me, my children, For (Ps. 119:1, 2; 128:1; Prov. 29:18; Luke 11:28) blessed are those who keep my ways.
Hear instruction and be wise, And do not disdain it.
(Prov. 3:13, 18) Blessed is the man who listens to me, Watching daily at my gates, Waiting at the posts of my doors.
For whoever finds me finds life, And (Prov. 3:4; 12:2; (John 17:3)) obtains favor from the LORD;
But he who sins against me (Prov. 20:2) wrongs his own soul; All those who hate me love death.”
The Way of Wisdom Wisdom has ((Matt. 16:18; 1 Cor. 3:9, 10; Eph. 2:20-22; 1 Pet. 2:5)) built her house, She has hewn out her seven pillars;
(Matt. 22:4) She has slaughtered her meat, (Prov. 23:30) She has mixed her wine, She has also furnished her table.
She has sent out her maidens, She cries out from the highest places of the city,
“Whoever (Ps. 19:7) is simple, let him turn in here!” As for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
“Come, (Song 5:1; Is. 55:1; (John 6:27)) eat of my bread And drink of the wine I have mixed.
Forsake foolishness and live, And go in the way of understanding.
“He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, And he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.
(Prov. 15:12; Matt. 7:6) Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; (Ps. 141:5; Prov. 10:8) Rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.
Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; Teach a just man, ((Matt. 13:12)) and he will increase in learning.
